page.title: 03Wray Endowed Primary School
page.content: Wray Endowed County Primary School is 300 years old. At present, there are thirty-six children in the school, and two teachers. It has two large classrooms which look out on to the surrounding countryside. The walls are bright with project work. Infants, aged between four and seven, are started off on their reading and writing and they learn lots of things through play. The junior children work upstairs and their curriculum includes science, history, geography, English, art, craft, drama and mathematics. There is also a computer which is in regular use. It is in an area which takes the 11+ test. This enables some children to go to the Grammar Schools in Lancaster. Others go to secondary schools in Lancaster, Hornby, or Kirkby Lonsdale.
